question: The International Day of Family Remittances is observed on
explanation: The International Day of Family Remittances (IDFR), celebrated on 16 June. It is aimed at recognizing the significant financial contribution migrant workers make to the wellbeing of their families back home and to the sustainable development of their countries of origin. It is also aimed at encouraging the public and private sectors, as well as the civil society, to do more and collaborate to maximize the impact of these funds in the developing world.
